title: The Ultimate Foe
dialogue_triumphs: In all my travelling throughout the universe I have battled against evil, against power-mad conspirators. I should have stayed here. The oldest civilisation: decadent, degenerate, and rotten to the core. Power-mad conspirators, Daleks, Sontarans… Cybermen, they're still in the nursery compared to us. Ten million years of absolute power. That's what it takes to be really corrupt.
The Master attempting to hypnotise Glitz with a swinging watch: 'Are you listening, Sabalom Glitz?' Glitz: 'Not really, I was just wondering how many grotzis this little bauble cost you.'
dialogue_disasters: That's it, Doc, now we're getting at the dirt.
I'm about as truthful, honest, and as boring as they come.
Never mind the Sidney Carton heroics.
There's nothing you can do to prevent the catharsis of spurious morality!

continuity_notes.name: Time Lords
continuity_notes.description: The oldest civilization in the known universe, with great power for ten million years.
continuity_notes.current_status: Decadent and corrupt, with the High Council deposed and insurrectionists running amok in the Capitol.

continuity_notes.name: The Matrix
continuity_notes.description: A vast computer network containing the knowledge and experiences of Time Lords.
continuity_notes.current_status: Can be physically entered, contains different levels of perceived reality.

continuity_notes.name: The Valeyard
continuity_notes.description: An amalgamation of all the Doctor's evil, between his twelfth and final incarnation.
continuity_notes.current_status: Promised the Doctor's remaining incarnations by the High Council.

continuity_notes.name: Earth
continuity_notes.description: Planet moved billions of miles across space by Time Lords.
continuity_notes.current_status: Renamed Ravolox, nearly destroyed by a fireball caused by moving the sun.

technobabble: Particle disseminator that disseminates gravitons, quarks and tau mesons

future_history: The trial takes place around two million years after the 20th century, with Time Lord civilization existing from eight million years in Earth's past to at least two million years in the future.
untold_adventures: The Doctor's adventures with Mel before and after the events of the trial
The Doctor potentially visiting Peri to check on her health after returning Mel to her correct point in time
additional_notes: The episode features a complex timeline involving Mel and the Doctor, with Mel meeting a future version of the Doctor during the trial before her first chronological meeting with him.
bottom_line: We watched the whole of 'Trial' in a day, and expected to hate it, but apart from padding in the middle, and some preposterous dialogue, the plot hangs together remarkably well. Episode 13 is a masterpiece, and, considering the production nightmare, 14 achieves near-greatness.
